examples: Their bread and butter is reporting local events.
The event finished with a spectacular fireworks display.
These events occurred within living memory.
The tragic event tore the community out of its sense of normalcy.
The paper’s bread and butter is reporting local events in a small community.
words.defineEn: anything that takes place, particularly something important
words.defineVi: bất cứ điều gì diễn ra, đặc biệt là một cái gì đó quan trọng

examples: Things like this take time.
Time is moving on.
The time passed quickly.
Time to bust a move.
The contractor is really taking their time.
words.defineEn: the quantity that is measured in seconds, minutes, hours, etc. using a device like clock
words.defineVi: số lượng được đo bằng giây, phút, giờ, v.v. bằng thiết bị như đồng hồ

examples: The clock said three o'clock.
Set the alarm for 7 o'clock.
The library opens at 10 o'clock on weekdays.
She finishes her piano practice at 7 o'clock.
The restaurant reservation is for 8 o'clock tonight.
words.defineEn: put after the numbers one to twelve to show or tell what time it is, only when it is at that exact hour
words.defineVi: đặt sau các số từ một đến mười hai để hiển thị hoặc cho biết mấy giờ rồi, chỉ khi nó vào chính xác giờ đó

examples: I usually take a lunch break around noon for an hour.
Every day about noon, traffic in town grinds to a halt.
The boss was mad because Tom called it a day at noon and went home.
12:00 noon Pacific, Yahoo page goes live.
Noon, what is that?
The clock showed midnight.
The clock struck twenty times at midnight.
He gave me a ring at midnight.
As midnight approaches, Buddhist temples around the country begin ringing out the old year.
Lawmakers were burning the midnight oil last night, as the debate continued.
words.defineEn: the middle of the night when the clock shows 12 AM
words.defineVi: giữa đêm khi đồng hồ chỉ 12 giờ sáng

examples: He set the alarm for 7 a.m.
We didn't get to bed until 3 a.m.
At precisely 6:45 a.m. the rowdiness ceases as Sailor, a union safety expert, takes the floor for his weekly lecture.
We're open from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.
The executive team touches base for 15 minutes every morning at 8:45 a.m. to raise any pressing issues.
words.defineEn: before noon; between midnight and noon
words.defineVi: trước buổi trưa; giữa nửa đêm và trưa

examples: Dinner is served between 7 and 10 p.m.
The store will close at 9 p.m. tonight.
The party started at 7 p.m., and it's getting on for 10 o'clock now.
The event starts at 7 p.m., and it's getting on now.
We're open from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.
words.defineEn: after noon; between noon and midnight
words.defineVi: buổi chiều; giữa trưa và nửa đêm

examples: The library closes early on Sundays.
She sent the kids to bed early.
Her early research laid the foundation for many important medical discoveries.
Book early and save £50!
For some people, early morning jogging is their cup of tea.
words.defineEn: happening or done before the usual, expected, or scheduled time
words.defineVi: xảy ra hoặc thực hiện trước thời gian thông thường, dự kiến, hoặc theo lịch trình

examples: The bus came right on time.
The bus will arrive on time.
The train arrived at the platform right on time.
We'll get there on time.
The meeting finished on time, and everyone left the room.
words.defineEn: on a time that is supposed to
words.defineVi: vào một thời điểm được cho là

examples: Spring came late this year.
Her latest novel takes the lid off the international art world.
The government's latest proposals are a dog's dinner.
She was only five minutes late!
The latest smartphone is now on the market.
words.defineEn: doing or happening not at the time that is usual or expected, but after it
words.defineVi: làm hoặc xảy ra không phải vào thời điểm thông thường hoặc dự kiến, nhưng sau đó
